Wada Home Care Taker Service is a medical specialty that helps you and your family focus on the quality of life. We care about the people in our community who are helpless. By providing physical, emotional and spiritual comfort, Home Care Taker Service uses an interdisciplinary team approach to respond to the diversity of needs of you and your family and provide the best care possible. After survey conducted in urban and rural areas by the institution, it was found that most of the people don’t take proper treatment due to sufficient money, now a special discount card has been issued for such people, by whom people can take care of their health. On the other hand, in the field of education, it is found that due to the increasing cost of books, parents are unable to provide education to the children or try to give better education to any one child in the family.

In order to provide encouragement in serious problems like health and education, our organization has used a special discount card, by which people can save their financial savings. The discount card will work not only on some major institutions but also in private hospitals, physiotherapy centers, pathology labs, grocery stores, shopping malls, printing presses, readymade stores, footwear, beauty parlors and saloons, tours and travel and other places. There will also be a special discount or exemption on travel expenses and fares for those traveling in India and abroad.

Wada discount card is a card or document, often a plastic credit card or paper card, that entitles the holder to discounts on the prices of some products or services. Cards may be issued as part of a loyalty program, offering discounts to existing customers to ensure their continuing custom; they may be offered free of charge, offering a modest discount with the intention of persuading purchasers to patronize participating shops; or they may be sold to members, offering larger discounts—for example, the offers 50% discounts at many restaurants at a substantial annual cost. Cards may be offered by merchants or groups of merchants, by clubs or associations who negotiate on behalf of all members to obtain benefits, or by official organizations offering concessionary prices to qualifying groups.
